Class BatchExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • BatchExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<MetaMedia>

    public class BatchExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<MetaMedia>

    Automates the batch processing of image files by copying, renaming, and chronologically sorting them based on their EXIF metadata, such as DateTimeOriginal.

    Supported formats include JPEG, TIFF, PNG, WebP and HEIF. If EXIF metadata is unavailable, the file's last modified time-stamp is assumed.

    To access the sorted set of files, iterate using the Iterable<MetaMedia> interface.

    Since:
    4 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs
    See Also:
    MetaMedia

      • processSourceDirectory

        private void processSourceDirectory()
                             throws BatchErrorException
        Visitor class for walking the source directory tree. For each image file, it extracts capture metadata or falls back to file modification time, then adds it to the internal set.
        Throws:
        BatchErrorException - in case of an error during batch processing

                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           common.ImageReadErrorException
        Processes the specified file and adds to the data structure according to the file signature for efficient retrieval.
        Parameters:

        attr - the attributes of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading the file
        common.ImageReadErrorException - in the event of image parsing problems

      • resolveDateTaken

        private static java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime resolveDateTaken(java.util.Date metadataDate,
                                                                 java.nio.file.Path fpath,
                                                                 java.nio.file.attribute.BasicFileAttributes attr,
                                                                 java.lang.String userDateTime)
        Determines the appropriate Date Taken time-stamp for the image file.

        The method prioritises date sources based on the following order:

        1. A user-provided date, if available.
        2. The date from image metadata, for example: EXIF or Textual chunk, if available.
        3. The file's last modified time-stamp.

        If a user-provided date is used, a 10-second offset is applied to prevent duplicate time-stamps for multiple files processed with the same date, ensuring proper sorting.

        Parameters:
        metadataDate - the date retrieved from the image's metadata, for example: EXIF, PNG text)
        fpath - the path to the image file
        attr - the file's basic attributes, used as a fallback value to get the last modified time
        userDateTime - a user-defined date that overrides all other date sources
        Returns:
        a FileTime object representing the determined "Date Taken" time-stamp

      • deleteTargetDirectory

        private static void deleteTargetDirectory(java.nio.file.Path dir)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Permanently deletes the target directory and all of its contents. This operation is destructive and cannot be undone.
        Parameters:
        dir - the path of the directory to delete
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while deleting files or directories
